Yes, several other countries have hospital ships that provide medical assistance during emergencies. For example, the People's Liberation Army Navy (PLAN) of China has a hospital ship called the Peace Ark, which has been deployed on numerous humanitarian missions around the world. It has treated thousands of patients in countries such as Pakistan, Tanzania, and Syria.

Other countries with hospital ships include Japan, which has the JDS Shimokita, a vessel equipped with operating rooms, an ICU, and a dental clinic. The Brazilian Navy also has a hospital ship called the NAsH (Navio de Assistência Hospitalar) Carlos Chagas, which provides medical assistance to remote areas along the Amazon River.

In addition, several international aid organizations, such as Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) and the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), operate hospital ships to provide medical assistance to people in need around the world.
